metadata.Title: CVE-2020-1749 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel's implementation of some networkingprotocols in IPsec, such as VXLAN and GENEVE tunnels over IPv6. When anencrypted tunnel is created between two hosts, the kernel isn't correctlyrouting tunneled data over the encrypted link; rather sending the dataunencrypted. This would allow anyone in between the two endpoints to readthe traffic unencrypted. The main threat from this vulnerability is to dataconfidentiality.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-1749` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-184.214
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-184.214
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-106.107~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-106.107~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-106.107~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1075.82
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1109.120
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1073.77~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1089.99~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1077.87~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1045.49~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1134-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1134.143
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1138-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1138.146
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-184.214').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-106.107~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1075.82').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1109.120').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1073.77~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1089.99~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1077.87~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1045.49~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1134.143').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1138.146').
